Standard_Text:
Examine the
practices, issues, and
ethics of appropriation,
fair use, copyright, open
source, and creative
commons as they apply
to creating works of art
and design.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use different forms,
styles, and genres of
drama/theatre work to
examine contemporary
social, cultural, or
global issues.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art. Examine a community
issue through multiple
perspectives in a
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Differentiate the
effect of technical
theatre elements
used in a drama/
theatre work to assess
aesthetic choices.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Assess the impact of
a drama/theatre work
on a specific audience.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Respond to a drama/
theatre work using
supporting evidence,
personal aesthetics,
and artistic criteria.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Apply personal
aesthetics, preferences,
and beliefs to evaluate
a drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyze how cultural
contexts influence the
evaluation of a drama/
theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Recognize and
share artistic choices
when participating in
or observing a drama/
theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work. Apply appropriate
criteria to the evaluation
of artistic choices in a
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work. Perform a rehearsed,
scripted scene from a
drama/theatre work for
an audience.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use a variety of
technical theatre
elements to create a
design for a rehearsal
or drama/theatre
production.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use a variety of
acting techniques to
increase skills in a
rehearsal or drama/
theatre performance.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use various character
objectives and tactics
in a drama/theatre
work to overcome an
obstacle.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explore different
pacing to better
communicate the story
in a drama/theatre
work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Implement and
refine a planned design
using technical theatre
elements during the
rehearsal process for
devised or scripted
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Refine effective
physical, vocal, and
physiological traits
of characters in an
improvised or scripted
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Practice collaboration,
analysis, and reflection
to refine a devised or
scripted drama/theatre
work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Share leadership
and responsibilities to
develop collaborative
goals when preparing or
devising drama/theatre
work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Articulate and
apply critical analysis,
personal experience,
research, and historical
and cultural context
to the development
of original ideas for a
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Imagine and explore
solutions to design
challenges of a
performance space in a
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop a scripted
or improvised character
by articulating the
character’s inner
thoughts, objectives,
and motivations in a
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Imagine and explore
multiple perspectives
and solutions to staging
problems in a drama/
theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Examine and demonstrate
connections between music and
societal, cultural, and historical
contexts when creating, performing,
and responding.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Examine and demonstrate how
personal interests, knowledge, and
ideas relate to choices and intent
when creating, performing, and
responding to music.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Apply appropriate personally
developed criteria to evaluate musical
works or performances.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Evaluate
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Support personal interpretations of
contrasting programs of music and
explain how creators’ and performers’
apply the elements of music and
expressive qualities, within genres,
cultures, and historical periods, to
convey expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify and compare the context of
programs of music from a variety of
genres, cultures, and historical
periods.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Compare how the elements of
music and expressive qualities relate
to the structure within programs of
music.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Analyze
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select programs of music and
demonstrate the connections to an
interest or experience for a specific
purpose.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate performance decorum
and audience etiquette appropriate for
venue, purpose, context, and style.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform the music, alone or with
others, with technical accuracy,
stylistic expression, and culturally
authentic practices in music to convey
the creator’s intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify and apply personally
developed criteria (such as
demonstrating correct interpretation of
notation, technical skill of performer,
originality, emotional impact, variety,
and interest) to rehearse, refine, and
determine when the music is ready to
perform.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform contrasting pieces of music,
demonstrating and explaining how the
music’s intent is conveyed by
interpretations of the elements of
music and expressive qualities (such
as articulation/style and phrasing).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identity how personal, social,
cultural, and historical context inform
performances and result in different
music interpretations.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
When analyzing selected music,
sight-read in treble, alto, or bass clef
simple rhythmic, melodic, and/or
harmonic notation.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Compare the structure of
contrasting pieces of music selected
for performance, explaining how the
elements of music are used in each.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Analyze
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Apply personally developed criteria for
selecting music of contrasting styles
for a program with a specific purpose
and/or context, and explain expressive
qualities, technical challenges, and
reasons for choices.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Present the final version of documented
personal composition, song, or
arrangement, using craftsmanship and
originality to demonstrate the application
of compositional techniques for creating
unity and variety, tension and release, and
balance to convey expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Present
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe the rationale for refining
works by explaining the choices, based
on evaluation criteria.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Evaluate personal work by selecting
and applying criteria including
appropriate application of compositional
techniques, style, form, and use of
sound sources.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Evaluate and Refine
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use standard and/or iconic notation
and/or audio/video recording to
document personal rhythmic phrases,
melodic phrases, and harmonic
sequences.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select, organize, and document
personal musical ideas for
arrangements, songs, and
compositions within expanded forms
that demonstrate tension and release,
unity and variety, balance, and convey
expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Generate rhythmic, melodic, and
harmonic phrases and harmonic
accompaniments within expanded forms
(including introductions, transitions, and
codas) that convey expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Connect and demonstrate
the relationships between
music and societal, cultural,
and historical contexts when
creating, performing, and
responding.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Connect and demonstrate
how personal interests,
knowledge, and skills relate
to choices and intent when
creating, performing, and
responding to music.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and apply teacher provided and established
criteria based on personal
preference, analysis, and
context (personal, social,
and cultural) to evaluate
individual and small group
musical selections.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain and support
possible interpretations
of the expressive intent
and meaning of musical
selections, citing as evidence
the treatment of the
elements of music, context
(personal, social, and
cultural), (when applicable)
the setting of the text, and
outside sources.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Compare passages in
musical selections and
explain how the elements of
music and context (social,
cultural, or historical) inform
the response.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Apply criteria to select
music for specified purposes,
supporting choices by citing
characteristics found in
the music and connections
to interest, purpose, and
context (social, cultural, and
historical).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform with expression
and technical accuracy,
in individual and small
group performances, a
varied repertoire of music
that includes melodies,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns, demonstrating
sensitivity to the audience
and an understanding of the
context (social, cultural, or
historical).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and apply criteria
to critique individual and
small group performances
of a varied repertoire of
music that includes melodies,
improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments
in a variety of patterns, and
create rehearsal strategies
to address performance
challenges and refine the
performances.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe in interpretations
the context (social, cultural,
or historical) and expressive
intent in a varied repertoire
of music selected for
performance that includes
melodies, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in
a variety of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify and describe
important theoretical and
structural characteristics
and context (social,
cultural, or historical) in a
varied repertoire of music
that includes melodies,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain the criteria used
when selecting a varied
repertoire of music for
individual or small group
performances that include
melodies, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in
a variety of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform final versions of
improvisations, compositions,
and three-or-more
chord accompaniments
in a variety of patterns,
demonstrating technical
skill in applying principles of
composition/improvisation
and originality in developing
and organizing musical ideas.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and apply criteria
to critique, improve, and
refine drafts of improvisations,
compositions and three or more chord accompaniments
in a variety of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select, develop, and use
standard notation and audio/
video recording to document
melodic, rhythmic, and
harmonic ideas for drafts of
improvisations, compositions,
and three-or-more chord
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Generate melodic, rhythmic,
and harmonic ideas for
improvisations, compositions,
and three-or-more chord
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding. Distinguish different
ways art is used to
represent, establish,
reinforce, and reflect
group identity.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art. Make art collaboratively
to reflect on and
reinforce positive
aspects of group identity.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work. Create a convincing
and logical argument to
support an evaluation
of art.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work. Interpret art by
analyzing how the
interaction of subject
matter, characteristics
of form and structure,
use of media, artmaking approaches,
and relevant contextual
information contributes
to understanding
messages or ideas and
mood conveyed.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Compare and contrast
contexts and media in
which viewers encounter
images that influence
ideas, emotions, and
actions.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain how a person’s
aesthetic choices are
influenced by culture,
environment, and
personal experiences
that impacts the
message it conveys to
others.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work. Analyze why and how an
exhibition or collection
may influence ideas,
beliefs, and experiences.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation. Collaboratively prepare
and present selected
theme-based artwork
for display, and
formulate exhibition
narratives for the viewer.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation. Develop and apply
criteria for evaluating
a collection of artwork
for presentation.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Presenting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Refine and Complete Artistic Work. Apply relevant criteria
to examine, reflect on,
and plan revisions for a
work of art or design in
progress.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select, organize, and
design images and
words to make visually
clear and compelling
presentations.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate awareness
of practices, issues, and
ethics of appropriation,
fair use, copyright, open
source, and Creative
Commons as they apply
to creating works of art
and design.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate willingness
to experiment, innovate,
and take risks to pursue
ideas, forms, and
meanings that emerge
in the process of
artmaking or designing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Collaboratively shape
an artistic investigation
of an aspect of
present-day life using a
contemporary practice
of art and design.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Document early
stages of the creative
process visually and/or
verbally in traditional or
contemporary media.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyze and
responsibly interact
with media arts tools,
environments, and
legal and technological
contexts, considering
ethics, media literacy,
social media, and
virtual worlds.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate and
explain how media
artworks and ideas
relate to various
contexts, purposes,
and values, such as
democracy, environment,
and connecting people
and places.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical
Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain and
demonstrate how
media artworks expand
meaning and knowledge,
and create cultural
experiences, such as
local and global events.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Access, evaluate,
and use internal and
external resources, such
as cultural and societal
knowledge, research,
and exemplary works, to
inform the creation of
media artworks.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Evaluate media
artworks and production
processes with
developed criteria,
considering context and
artistic goals.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyze the intent and
meanings of a variety
of media artworks,
focusing on intentions,
forms, and various
contexts.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Compare, contrast,
and analyze how various
forms, methods, and
styles in media artworks
manage audience
experience and create
intention.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Compare, contrast,
and analyze the
qualities of and
relationships between
the components,
content, and intentions
in media artworks.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Design the presentation
and distribution of
media artworks through
multiple formats and/
or contexts considering
previous results on
personal growth and
external effects.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate a
defined range of
creative and innovative
abilities, such as
divergent solutions and
bending conventions,
in developing new
solutions for identified
problems within and
through media arts
productions.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate a
defined range of artistic,
design, technical,
and soft skills, such
as strategizing
and collaborative
communication, through
performing specified
roles in producing
media artworks.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Integrate multiple
contents and forms
into unified media
arts productions, such
as interdisciplinary
projects or multimedia
theatre, that convey
specific themes or ideas.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Producing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Refine media
artworks, improving
technical quality
and intentionally
accentuating stylistic
elements, to reflect
an understanding of
purpose, audience, and
place.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Implement
production processes to
integrate content and
stylistic conventions for
determined purpose
and meaning in media
arts productions,
demonstrating
understanding of
associated aesthetic
principles, such as
theme and unity.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Structure and critique
ideas, plans, prototypes,
and production
processes for media
arts productions,
considering intent,
resources, and the
presentation context.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Generate ideas, goals,
and solutions for
original media artworks
through application
of focused creative
processes, such as
divergent thinking and
experimenting.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyze and discuss
how dances from a
variety of cultures,
societies, historical
periods, or communities
reveal the ideas and
perspectives of the
people.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Investigate two
contrasting topics using
a variety of research
methods. Identify
and organize ideas to
create representative
movement phrases.
Create a dance
study exploring the
contrasting ideas.
Discuss how the
research informed
the choreographic
process and deepens
understanding of the
topics.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Relate connections
found between different
dances and discuss
the relevance of the
connections to the
development of one’s
personal perspectives.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use artistic criteria
to determine what
makes an effective
performance. Consider
content, context, genre,
style, or cultural
movement practice to
comprehend artistic
expression. Use
genre-specific dance
terminology.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select a dance and
explain how artistic
expression is achieved
through relationships
among the elements
of dance, use of body,
dance technique, dance
structure, and context.
Cite evidence in the
dance to support your
interpretation using
genre-specific dance
terminology.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain how
the elements of
dance are used in
a variety of genres,
styles, or cultural
movement practices
to communicate intent.
Use genre-specific
dance terminology.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe,
demonstrate, and
discuss patterns of
movement and their
relationships in dance
in context of artistic
intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Collaborate to design
and execute production
elements that would
intensify and heighten
the artistic intent of a
dance performed on
a stage, in a different
venue, or for different
audiences. Explain
reasons for choices
using production
terminology
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate
leadership qualities
(e.g., commitment,
dependability,
responsibility, and
cooperation) when
preparing for
performances. Use
performance etiquette
and performance
practices during
class, rehearsal, and
performance. After
the performance,
accept notes from
choreographer and
apply corrections to
future performances.
Document efforts
and create a plan for
ongoing improvements.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Collaborate with
peers to discover
strategies for
achieving performance
accuracy, clarity,
and expressiveness.
Articulate personal
performance goals and
practice to reach goals.
Document personal
improvement over
time (e.g., journaling,
portfolio, or timeline).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Evaluate personal
healthful practices in
dance activities and
everyday life including
nutrition and injury
prevention. Discuss
choices made, the
effects experienced,
and methods for
improvement.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Embody technical
dance skills (e.g.,
functional alignment,
coordination, balance,
core support, clarity
of movement, weight
shifts, flexibility/range
of motion) to replicate,
recall, and execute
spatial designs and
musical or rhythmical
dance phrases.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Direct energy and
dynamics in such a
way that movement is
textured. Incorporate
energy and dynamics
to technique exercises
and dance performance.
Use energy and
dynamics to enhance
and project movements.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyze and select
metric, kinetic, and
breath phrasing and
apply appropriately to
dance phrases. Perform
dance phrases of
different lengths that
use various timings
within the same section.
Use different tempi in
different body parts at
the same time.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Sculpt the body in
space and design body
shapes in relation to
other dancers, objects,
and environment. Use
focus during complex
floor and air patterns
and/or pathways.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Experiment with
aspects of a recognized
system and use the
system to document
one or more sections
of a dance (e.g., writing,
a form of notation
symbols, or using media
technologies).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Revise choreography
collaboratively or
independently based
on artistic criteria,
self-reflection, and the
feedback of others.
Articulate the reasons
for choices and
revisions and explain
how they clarify and
enhance the artistic
intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Define and apply
artistic criteria to
choreograph a dance
that communicates
personal or cultural
meaning. Discuss how
the criteria clarify or
intensify the meaning of
the dance.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Collaborate to select
and apply a variety of
choreographic devices
and dance structures
to choreograph an
original dance study
or dance with a clear
artistic intent. Articulate
the group process for
making movement and
structural choices.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify and select
personal preferences
to create an original
dance study or dance.
Use genre-specific
dance terminology to
articulate and justify
choices made in
movement development
to communicate intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Implement movement
from a variety of stimuli
(e.g., music, observed
dance, literary forms,
notation, natural
phenomena, personal
experience/recall,
current news or social
events) to develop
dance content for an
original dance study or
dance.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)
